title: Corporate Financial Policy
description: An overview of the factors that affect corporate financial decisions, including firms' financing, investment and hedging policies. Factors included: taxes, transaction costs, contracting (between managers and shareholders, and between shareholders and other claimholders such as bondholders), and asymmetric information. 3 seminars, 1 activity.
prerequisites: GSB 531 and OCOB graduate standing or approval from the Associate Dean
